1

After a hurried breakfast - [he]96-iran had lost time due to the discussion with [[his]96-iran wife]280-his wife - [he]96-iran ascended clad for venturing out , including [[his]96-iran Ajax model Mountibank Lead Codpiece]299-his ajax model mountibank lead codpiece , to [the covered roof pasture whereon [his]96-iran electric sheep]300-the covered roof pasture whereon his electric sheep " grazed . Of course , some of [their]301-the other tenants of the building animals undoubtedly consisted of electronic circuitry fakes , too ;

[he]96-iran had of course never nosed into the matter , any more than [they]303-they , [[his]96-iran neighbors]304-his neighbors , had pried into the real workings of [his]96-iran sheep . Nothing could be more impolite . To say , " Is [your]96-iran sheep genuine ? "[303-they] would be a worse breach of manners than to inquire whether [a citizen]305-a citizen 's teeth , hair , or internal organs would test out authentic . The morning air , spilling over with radioactive motes , gray and sun - beclouding , belched about [him]96-iran , haunting [his]96-iran nose ; fie sniffed involuntarily the taint of death . Well , that was too strong a description for it , [he]96-iran decided as [he]96-iran made [his]96-iran way to [the particular plot of sod which [he]96-iran owned]306-the particular plot of sod which he owned along with [the unduly large apartment below]307-the unduly large apartment below . The legacy of World War Terminus had diminished in potency ; [those who could not survive the dust]308-those who could not survive the dust had passed into oblivion years ago , and the dust , weaker now and confronting [the strong survivors]309-the strong survivors , only deranged minds and genetic properties . Despite [his]96-iran lead codpiece the dustundoubtedly - filtered in and at [him]96-iran , brought [him]96-iran daily , so long as [he]96-iran failed to emigrate , its little load of befouling filth . So far , medical checkups taken monthly confirmed [him]96-iran as [a regular]310-a regular : [a man who could reproduce within the tolerances set by law]311-a man who could reproduce within the tolerances set by law . Any month , however , the exam by [the San Francisco Police Department doctors]312-the san francisco police department doctors could reveal otherwise . Continually , [new specials]313-new specials came into existence , created out of regulars by the omnipresent dust . The saying currently blabbed by posters , TV ads , and government junk mail , ran : " Emigrate or degenerate ! The choice is [yours]1799-yours ! "[98-barbour] " [I]95-rick say pretty soon [you]98-barbour 'll have two horses , "[95-rick] [Rick]95-rick said . "[318-she] [Rick]95-rick asked . [He]95-rick wished to god [he]95-rick had a horse , in fact any animal . Owning and maintaining a fraud had a way of gradually demoralizing

one . And yet from a social standpoint it had to be done , given the absence of the real article . [He]95-rick had therefore no choice except to continue . Even were [he]95-rick not to care [himself]95-rick , there remained [[his]95-rick wife]280-his wife , and [Iran]96-iran did care . Very much . "[100-puzzled] [Puzzled]100-puzzled , [Barbour]98-barbour said , " How do [you]95-rick mean ? [A lot of [people]1804-people]1803-a lot of people have two animals , even three , four , and like in the case of [Fred Washborne]101-fred washborne , who owns the algae - processing plant [[my]98-barbour brother]1805-my brother works at , even five . "[98-barbour] [The man]320-the man 's eyes glazed over , imagining such possessions ; [he]320-the man drifted by degrees into a trance . Exploring about in [his]95-rick coat pockets , [Rick]95-rick found [his]95-rick creased , much - studied copy of [Sidney]102-sidney 's Animal & Fowl Catalogue January supplement . [He]95-rick looked in the index , found colts ( vide horses , offsp . ) and presently had the prevailing national price . " [I]95-rick can buy a Percheron colt from [Sidney]102-sidney 's for five thousand dollars , "[95-rick] [he]95-rick said aloud . " No [you]95-rick ca n't , "[98-barbour] [Barbour]98-barbour said . 2

In [a giant , empty , decaying building which had once housed [thousands]357-thousands]356-a giant , empty , decaying building which had once housed thousands , [a single TV set]358-a single tv set hawked its wares to [an uninhabited room]359-an uninhabited room . [This ownerless ruin]360-this ownerless ruin had , before World War Terminus , been tended and maintained . [Here]1780-here had been [the suburbs of [San Francisco]16-san francisco]362-the suburbs of san francisco , a short ride by [monorail rapid transit]363-monorail rapid transit ; [the entire peninsula]364-the entire peninsula had chattered like a bird tree with life and opinions and complaints , and now [the watchful owners]365-the watchful owners had either died or migrated to [a colony world]366-a colony world . Mostly the former ; it had been a costly war despite the valiant predictions of [the Pentagon]17-the pentagon and [[its]17-the pentagon smug scientific vassel]367-its smug scientific vassel , [the Rand Corporation]18-the rand corporation - which had , in fact , existed not far from [this spot]368-this spot . Like [the apartment owners]369-the apartment owners , [the corporation]370-the corporation had departed , evidently for good . [No one]327-no one missed it . In addition , [no one]327-no one today remembered why the war had come about or who , if anyone , had won . The dust which had contaminated [most of [the planet]374-the planet 's surface]373-most of the planet 's surface had originated in [no country]375-no country and [no one]327-no one , even [the wartime enemy]377-the wartime enemy , had planned on [it]378-it . First , strangely , the owls had died . At the time it had seemed almost funny , the fat , fluffy white birds lying here and there , in [yards]379-yards and on [streets]380-streets ; coming out no earlier than twilight as [they]381-they had while alive the owls escaped notice . Medieval plagues had manifested themselves in a similar way , in the form of many dead rats . This plague , however , had descended from above . After the owls , of course , the other birds followed , but by then the mystery had been grasped and understood . A meager colonization program had been underway before the war but now that the sun had ceased to shine on [Earth]14-earth the colonization entered an entirely new phase . In connection with this a weapon of war , [the Synthetic Freedom Fighter]382-the synthetic freedom fighter , had been modified ; able to function on [an alien world]383-an alien world [the humanoid robotstrictly speaking , the organic android]384-the humanoid robotstrictly speaking , the organic android - had become [the mobile donkey engine of the colonization program]385-the mobile donkey engine of the colonization program . Under U.N. law [each emigrant]386-each emigrant automatically received possession of an android subtype of [his]386-each emigrant choice , and , by 1990 , the variety of subtypes passed all understanding , in the manner of [American automobiles of [the ig6os]388-the ig6os]387-american automobiles of the ig6os .

That had been the ultimate incentive of emigration : [the android servant]389-the android servant as carrot , the radioactive fallout as stick . [The U.N.]48-the u.n. had made it easy to emigrate , difficult if not impossible to stay . Loitering on [Earth]14-earth potentially meant finding [oneself]390-oneself abruptly classed as biologically unacceptable , a menace to the pristine heredity of [the race]391-the race . Once pegged as special , [a citizen]305-a citizen , even if accepting sterilization , dropped out of history . [He]305-a citizen ceased , in effect , to be part of [mankind]393-mankind . And yet [persons here and there]394-persons here and there declined to migrate ; that , even to [those involved]395-those involved , constituted a perplexing irrationality . Logically , [every regular]396-every regular should have emigrated already . Perhaps , deformed as it was , [Earth]14-earth remained familiar , to be clung to . Or possibly [the non - emigrant]397-the non - emigrant imagined that the tent of dust would deplete itself finally . In any case [thousands of [individuals]399-individuals]398-thousands of individuals remained , most of [them]398-thousands of individuals constellated in [urban areas where [they]398-thousands of individuals could physically see [one another]401-one another , take heart at [their]398-thousands of individuals mutual presence]400-urban areas where they could physically see one another , take heart at their mutual presence . [Those]402-those appeared to be [the relatively sane ones]403-the relatively sane ones . And , in dubious addition to [them]402-those , occasional peculiar entities remained in [the virtually abandoned suburbs]404-the virtually abandoned suburbs . [John Isidore]112-isidore , being yammered at by the television set in [[his]112-isidore living room]405-his living room as [he]112-isidore shaved in [the bathroom]406-the bathroom , was one of these . [He]112-isidore simply had wandered to this spot in the early days following the war . In those evil times [no one]327-no one had known , really , what [they]408-they were doing . [Populations , detached by the war]409-populations , detached by the war , had roamed , squatted temporarily at first [one region]410-one region and then another . Back then the fallout had been sporadic and highly variable ; [some states]411-some states had been nearly free of it , [others]412-others became saturated . [The displaced populations]413-the displaced populations moved as the dust moved . [The peninsula south of [San Francisco]16-san francisco]414-the peninsula south of san francisco had been at first dust - free , and a great body of [persons]415-persons had responded by taking up residence [there]416-there ; when the dust arrived , [some]417-some had died and [the rest]418-the rest had departed . [J. R. Isidore]113-isidore remained . [The TV set]419-the tv set shouted , " -duplicates the halcyon days of the pre - Civil War [Southern states]1824-southern states ! Either as [body servants]1825-body servants or tireless field hands , the custom - tailored humanoid robot designed specifically for [YOUR]1826-you UNIQUE NEEDS , FOR [YOU]1826-you AND [YOU]1826-you ALONEgiven to [you]1826-you on [your]1826-you arrival absolutely free , equipped fully , as specified by [you]1826-you before [your]1826-you departure from [Earth]1827-earth ; [this loyal , trouble - free companion in the greatest , boldest adventure contrived by [man in modern history]1829-man in modern history]1828-this loyal , trouble - free companion in the greatest , boldest adventure contrived by man in modern history will provide- "[419-the tv set] It continued on and on . [I]0-i wonder if [I]0-i 'm late for work , [Isidore]113-isidore wondered as [he]113-isidore scraped . "[427-my] To [himself]427-my [John Isidore]112-isidore thought acidly , And it 's gone away for [me]0-i , too , without [my]0-i having to emigrate . [He]112-isidore had been [a special now]428-a special now for over a year , and not merely in regard to the distorted genes which [he]112-isidore carried . Worse still , [he]112-isidore had failed to pass the minimum mental faculties test , which made [him]112-isidore in popular parlance a chickenhead . Upon [him]112-isidore the contempt of [three planets]429-three planets descended . However , despite this , [he]112-isidore survived . [He]112-isidore had [his]112-isidore job , driving [a pickup and delivery truck for [a false - animal repair firm]431-a false - animal repair firm]430-a pickup and delivery truck for a false - animal repair firm ; [the Van Ness Pet Hospital]432-the van ness pet hospital and [[his]112-isidore gloomy , gothic boss [Hannibal Sloat]115-mr. sloat]433-his gloomy , gothic boss hannibal sloat accepted [him]112-isidore as human and this [he]112-isidore appreciated . Mors certa , vita incerta , as [Mr. Sloat]115-mr. sloat occasionally declared . [Isidore]112-isidore , although [he]112-isidore had heard the expression a number of times , retained only a dim notion as to its meaning . " [-your husband]1837--your husband felt no protection , "[424-the tv announcer] [the TV announcer]424-the tv announcer was saying , " in owning and continually wearing an expensive and clumsy radiation - proof lead codpiece , [Mrs. Klugman]114-mrs. klugman ? "[424-the tv announcer] " [[My]114-mrs. klugman husband]1833-my husband , "[114-mrs. klugman] [Mrs. Klugman]114-mrs. klugman began , but at that point , having finished shaving , [Isidore]112-isidore strode into [the living room]295-the living room and shut off the TV set . Silence . It flashed from the woodwork and the walls ; it smote [him]112-isidore with an awful , total power , as if generated by a vast mill . It rose from the floor , up out of the tattered gray wall - to - wall carpeting . [It]439-it unleashed [itself]439-it from the broken and semi - broken appliances in [the kitchen]440-the kitchen , [the dead machines which had n't worked in all the time [Isidore]112-isidore had lived

[here]1780-here]441-the dead machines which had n't worked in all the time isidore had lived here . From the useless pole lamp in [the living room]295-the living room [it]439-it oozed out , meshing with the empty and wordless descent of itself from the fly - specked ceiling . It managed in fact to emerge from every object within [his]112-isidore range of vision , as if it - the silence meant to supplant all things tangible . Hence it assailed not only [his]112-isidore ears but [his]112-isidore eyes ; as [he]112-isidore stood by the inert TV set [he]112-isidore experienced the silence as visible and , in its own way , alive . Alive ! [He]112-isidore had often felt its austere approach before ; when it came it burst in without subtlety , evidently unable to wait . The silence of [the world]281-the world could not rein back its greed . Not any longer . Not when it had virtually won . [He]112-isidore wondered , then , if [the others who had remained on [Earth]14-earth]445-the others who had remained on earth experienced the void this way . Or was it peculiar to [his]112-isidore peculiar biological identity , a freak generated by [his]112-isidore inept sensory apparatus ? Interesting question , [Isidore]112-isidore thought . But whom could [he]112-isidore compare notes with ? [He]112-isidore lived alone in [this deteriorating , blind building of [a thousand uninhabited apartments]447-a thousand uninhabited apartments , which like all [its]446-this deteriorating , blind building of a thousand uninhabited apartments , which like all its counterparts counterparts]446-this deteriorating , blind building of a thousand uninhabited apartments , which like all its counterparts , fell , day by day , into greater entropic ruin . Eventually everything within [the building]1783-the building would merge , would be faceless and identical , mere pudding - like kipple piled to the ceiling of [each apartment]449-each apartment . And , after that , [the uncared - for building]450-the uncared - for building [itself]450-the uncared - for building would settle into shapelessness , buried under the ubiquity of the dust . By then , naturally , [he]112-isidore [himself]112-isidore would be dead , another interesting event to anticipate as [he]112-isidore stood here in [[his]112-isidore stricken living room]451-his stricken living room atone with the lungless , allpenetrating , masterful world - silence . Better , perhaps , to turn the TV back on . But the ads , directed at [the remaining regulars]452-the remaining regulars , frightened [him]112-isidore . [They]453-they informed [him]112-isidore in a countless procession of ways that [he]112-isidore , a special , was n't wanted . Had no use . Could not , even if [he]112-isidore wanted to , emigrate . So why listen to that ? [He]112-isidore asked [himself]112-isidore irritably . Fork [them]453-they and [[their]453-they colonization]454-their colonization , [I]0-i hope a war gets started there - after all , it theoretically could - and [they]453-they wind up like Earth . And [everybody who emigrated]455-everybody who emigrated turns out to be special . Okay , [he]112-isidore thought ; [I]0-i 'm off to work . [He]112-isidore reached for the doorknob that opened the way out into [the unlit hall]456-the unlit hall , then shrank back as [he]112-isidore glimpsed the vacuity of the rest of [the building]1783-the building . It lay in wait for [him]112-isidore , out here , the force which [he]112-isidore had felt busily penetrating [[his]112-isidore specific apartment]458-his specific apartment . God , [he]112-isidore thought , and reshut the door . [He]112-isidore was not ready for the trip up those clanging stairs to [the empty roof where [he]112-isidore had no animal]459-the empty roof where he had no animal . The echo of [himself]112-isidore ascending : the echo of nothing . Time to grasp the handles , [he]112-isidore said to [himself]112-isidore , and crossed [the living room]295-the living room to the black empathy box . When [he]112-isidore turned it on the usual faint smell of negative ions surged from the power supply ; [he]112-isidore breathed in eagerly , already buoyed up . Then the cathode - ray tube glowed like an imitation , feeble TV image ; a collage formed , made of apparently random colors , trails , and configurations which , until the handles were grasped , amounted to nothing . So , taking a deep breath to steady [himself]112-isidore , [he]112-isidore grasped the twin handles .

The visual image congealed ; [he]112-isidore saw at once [a famous landscape]461-a famous landscape , the old , brown , barren ascent , with tufts of dried - out bonelike weeds poking slantedly into a dim and sunless sky . [One single figure , more or less human in form]462-one single figure , more or less human in form , toiled its way up [the hillside]463-the hillside : [an elderly man wearing a dull , featureless robe , covering as meager as if it had been snatched from the hostile emptiness of the sky]464-an elderly man wearing a dull , featureless robe , covering as meager as if it had been snatched from the hostile emptiness of the sky . [The man]320-the man , [Wilbur Mercer]103-mercer , plodded ahead , and , as [he]112-isidore clutched the handles , [John Isidore]112-isidore gradually experienced a waning of [the living room in which [he]112-isidore stood]466-the living room in which he stood ; the dilapidated furniture and walls ebbed out and [he]112-isidore ceased to experience them at all . [He]112-isidore found [himself]112-isidore , instead , as always before , entering into [the landscape of drab hill]467-the landscape of drab hill , drab sky . And at the same time [he]112-isidore no longer witnessed the climb of [the elderly man]468-the elderly man . [His]112-isidore own feet now scraped , sought purchase , among the familiar loose stones ; [he]112-isidore felt the same old painful , irregular roughness beneath [his]112-isidore feet and once again smelled the acrid haze of the sky - not [Earth]14-earth 's sky but that of some place alien , distant , and yet , by means of the empathy box , instantly available . [He]112-isidore had crossed over in the usual perplexing fashion ; physical merging - accompanied by mental and spiritual identification - with [Wilbur Mercer]103-mercer had reoccurred . As it did for [everyone who at this moment clutched the handles]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles , either here on [Earth]14-earth or on [one of [the colony planets]1817-the colony planets]1816-one of the colony planets . [He]112-isidore experienced [them]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles , [the others]472-the others , incorporated the babble of [their]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles thoughts , heard in [his]112-isidore own brain the noise of [their]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles many individual existences . [They]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles - and [he]112-isidore - cared about one thing ; this fusion of [their]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles mentalities oriented [their]469-everyone who at this moment clutched the handles attention on [the hill]473-the hill , the climb , the need to ascend . Step by step it evolved , so slowly as to be nearly imperceptible . But it was there . Higher , [he]112-isidore thought as stones rattled downward under [his]112-isidore feet . Today [we]474-we are higher than yesterday , and tomorrow - [he]112-isidore , the compound figure of [Wilbur Mercer]103-mercer , glanced up to view the ascent ahead . Impossible to make out the end . Too far . But it would come . A rock , hurled at [him]112-isidore , struck [his]112-isidore arm . [He]112-isidore felt the pain . [He]112-isidore half turned and another rock sailed past [him]112-isidore , missing [him]112-isidore ; it collided with the earth and the sound startled [him]112-isidore . [Who]475-who ? [he]112-isidore wondered , peering to see [[his]112-isidore tormentor]476-his tormentor . [The old antagonists]477-the old antagonists , manifesting [themselves]477-the old antagonists at the periphery of [his]112-isidore vision ; it , or [they]477-the old antagonists , had followed [him]112-isidore all the way up [the hill]473-the hill and [they]477-the old antagonists would remain until at the topHe remembered the top , the sudden leveling of [the hill]473-the hill , when the climb ceased and the other part of it began . How many times had [he]112-isidore done this ? The several times blurred ; future and past blurred ; what [he]112-isidore had already experienced and what [he]112-isidore would eventually experience blended so that nothing remained but the moment , the standing still and resting during which [he]112-isidore rubbed the cut on [his]112-isidore arm which the stone had left . [God]109-god , [he]112-isidore thought in weariness . In what way is this fair ? Why am [I]0-i up here alone like this , being tormented by something [I]0-i ca n't even see ? And then , within [him]112-isidore , the mutual babble of [everyone else in fusion]480-everyone else in fusion broke the illusion of aloneness . [You]481-you felt it , too , [he]112-isidore thought . Yes , the voices answered . [We]482-we got hit , on the left arm ; it hurts

like hell . Okay , [he]112-isidore said . [We]482-we better get started moving again . [He]112-isidore resumed walking , and all of [them]477-the old antagonists accompanied [him]112-isidore immediately . Once , [he]112-isidore remembered , it had been different . Back before the curse had come , an earlier , happier part of life . [They]477-the old antagonists , [[his]112-isidore foster parents]483-his foster parents [Frank]117-frank and [Cora Mercer]118-mercer , had found [him]112-isidore floating on [an inflated rubber air - rescue raft]484-an inflated rubber air - rescue raft , off [the coast of [New England]25-new england]485-the coast of new england ... or had it been [Mexico]26-mexico , near [the port of [Tampico]27-tampico]486-the port of tampico ? [He]112-isidore did not now remember the circumstances . Childhood had been nice ; [he]112-isidore had loved all life , especially the animals , had in fact been able for a time to bring dead animals back as [they]487-they had been . [He]112-isidore lived with rabbits and bugs , wherever it was , either on [Earth]14-earth or [a colony world]366-a colony world ; now [he]112-isidore had forgotten that , too . But [he]112-isidore recalled [the killers]489-the killers , because [they]489-the killers had arrested [him]112-isidore as [a freak]490-a freak , more special than any of the other specials . And due to that everything had changed . Local law prohibited the time - reversal faculty by which [the dead]491-the dead returned to life ; [they]489-the killers had spelled it out to [him]112-isidore during [his]112-isidore sixteenth year . [He]112-isidore continued for another year to do it secret , in [the still remaining woods]492-the still remaining woods , but [an old woman whom [he]112-isidore had never seen or heard of]493-an old woman whom he had never seen or heard of had told . Without [[his]112-isidore parents]494-his parents ' consent [they]489-the killers - [the killers]489-the killers - had bombarded the unique nodule which had formed in [his]112-isidore brain , had attacked it with radioactive cobalt , and this had plunged [him]112-isidore into [a different world]496-a different world , one whose existence [he]112-isidore had never suspected . It had been a pit of corpses and dead bones and [he]112-isidore had struggled for years to get up from it . The donkey and especially the toad , the creatures most important to [him]112-isidore , had vanished , had become extinct ; only rotting fragments , an eyeless head here , part of a hand there , remained . At last a bird which had come [there to die]497-there to die told [him]112-isidore where [he]112-isidore was . [He]112-isidore had sunk down into [the tomb world]498-the tomb world . [He]112-isidore could not get out until the bones strewn around [him]112-isidore grew back into [living creatures]499-living creatures ; [he]112-isidore had become joined to the metabolism of other lives and until [they]489-the killers rose [he]112-isidore could not rise either . How long that part of the cycle had lasted [he]112-isidore did not now know ; nothing had happened , generally , so it had been measureless . But at last the bones had regained flesh ; the empty eyepits had filled up and the new eyes had seen , while meantime the restored beaks and mouths had cackled , barked , and caterwauled . Possibly [he]112-isidore had done it ; perhaps the extrasensory node of [his]112-isidore brain had finally grown back . Or maybe [he]112-isidore had n't accomplished it ; very likely it could have been a natural process . Anyhow [he]112-isidore was no longer sinking ; [he]112-isidore had begun to ascend , along with [the others]472-the others . Long ago [he]112-isidore had lost sight of them . [He]112-isidore found [himself]112-isidore evidently climbing alone . But [they]489-the killers were there . [They]489-the killers still accompanied [him]112-isidore ; [he]112-isidore felt [them]489-the killers , strangely , inside [him]112-isidore . [Isidore]112-isidore stood holding the two handles , experiencing [himself]112-isidore as encompassing every other living thing , and then , reluctantly , [he]112-isidore let go . It had to end , as always , and anyhow [his]112-isidore arm ached and bled where the rock had struck it . bathroom of [[his]112-isidore apartment]502-his apartment]501-the bathroom of his apartment to wash the cut off was not the first wound [he]112-isidore had received while in fusion with [Mercer]118-mercer and it probably would not be the last . For better or worse . [The servant]561-the servant had in some cases become more adroit than [its master]562-its master . [An android]563-an android , no matter how gifted as to pure intellectual capacity , could make no sense out of the fusion which took place routinely among [the followers of Mercerism]564-the followers of mercerism - an experience which [he]563-an android , and virtually everyone else , including [subnormal chickenheads]565-subnormal chickenheads , managed with

no difficulty . [He]95-rick had wondered as had [most people]291-most people at one time or another precisely why [an android]563-an android bounced helplessly about when confronted by an empathy - measuring test . Empathy , evidently , existed only within [the human community]568-the human community , whereas intelligence to some degree could be found throughout every phylum and order including the arachnids . For one thing , [the emphatic faculty]569-the emphatic faculty probably required an unimpaired group instinct ; a solitary organism , such as a spider , would have no use for it ; in fact it would tend to abort a spider 's ability to survive . It would make [him]95-rick conscious of the desire to live on the part of [[his]95-rick prey]570-his prey . Hence all predators , even highly developed mammals such as cats , would starve . Empathy , [he]95-rick once had decided , must be limited to herbivores or [anyhow omnivores who could depart from a meat diet]571-anyhow omnivores who could depart from a meat diet . Because , ultimatley , the emphatic gift blurred the boundaries between [hunter]572-hunter and [victim]573-victim , between the successful and the defeated . As in the fusion with [Mercer]118-mercer , [everyone]574-everyone ascended together or , when the cycle had come to an end , fell together into the trough of [the tomb world]498-the tomb world . Oddly , it resembled a sort of biological insurance , but double - edged . As long as [some creature]576-some creature experienced joy , then the condition for all other creatures included a fragment of joy . However , if [any living being]577-any living being suffered , then for all the rest the shadow could not be entirely cast off . A herd animal such as [man]578-man would acquire a higher survival factor through this ; an owl or a cobra would be destroyed . Evidently [the humanoid robot]579-the humanoid robot constituted a solitary predator . [Rick]95-rick liked to think of [them]579-the humanoid robot that way ; it made [his]95-rick job palatable . In retiring - i.e. killing - an andy [he]95-rick did not violate the rule of life laid down by [Mercer]118-mercer . [You]580-you shall kill only the kill ers , [Mercer]118-mercer had told [them]579-the humanoid robot the year empathy boxes first appeared on [Earth]14-earth . And in [Mercerism]127-mercerism , as it evolved into a full theology , the concept of [The Killers]489-the killers had grown insidiously . In [Mercerism]127-mercerism , an absolute evil plucked at the threadbare cloak of [the tottering , ascending old man]582-the tottering , ascending old man , but it was never clear who or what this evil presence was . [A Mercerite]128-a mercerite sensed evil without understanding it . 6

13

Like an arc of pure fire , [John R. Isidore]112-isidore soared across the late - afternoon sky on [his]112-isidore way [home]284-home from [his]112-isidore job . [I]0-i wonder if [she]1268-a female type of android 's still there , [he]112-isidore said to [himself]112-isidore . Down in [that kippleinfested old apt]1270-that kippleinfested old apt , watching [Buster Friendly]97-buster friendly on [her]1268-a female type of android TV set and quaking with fear every time [she]1268-a female type of android imagines [someone]1814-someone coming down [the hall]527-the hall . Including , [I]0-i suppose , [me]0-i . [He]112-isidore had already stopped off at [a blackmarket grocery store]1273-a blackmarket grocery store . On the seat beside [him]112-isidore a bag of such delicacies as bean curd , ripe peaches , good soft evil - smelling cheese rocked back and forth as [he]112-isidore alternately speeded up and slowed down [[his]112-isidore car]1812-his car ; being tense , tonight , [he]112-isidore drove somewhat erratically . And [[his]112-isidore allegedly repaired car]1275-his allegedly repaired car coughed and floundered , as it had been doing for months prior to overhaul . Rats , [Isidore]112-isidore said to [himself]112-isidore . The smell of peaches and cheese eddied about [the car]954-the car , filling [his]112-isidore nose with pleasure . All rarities , for which [he]112-isidore had squandered two weeks ' salary - borrowed in advance from [Mr. Sloat]115-mr. sloat . And , in addition , under the car seat where it could not roll and break , a bottle of Chablis wine knocked back and forth : the greatest rarity of all . [He]112-isidore had been keeping it in a safety deposit box at [the Bank of [America]24-america]76-the bank of america , hanging onto [it]1277-it and not selling it no matter how much [they]76-the bank of america offered , in case at some long , late , last moment [a girl]1278-a girl appeared . That had not happened , not until now . The rubbish - littered , lifeless roof of [[his]112-isidore apartment building]1279-his apartment building as always depressed [him]112-isidore . Reaching out , [he]216-roy baty touched the wall . [His]216-roy baty hand broke the surface ; gray particles trickled and hurried down , fragments of plaster resembling the radioactive dust outside . [He]216-roy baty seated [himself]216-roy baty at the table and , like rotten , hollow tubes the legs of the chair bent ; standing quickly , [he]216-roy baty set down the cup and tried to reform the chair , tried to press it back into its right shape . The chair came apart in [his]216-roy baty hands , the screws which had previously connected its several sections ripping out and hanging loose . [He]216-roy baty saw , on the table , the ceramic cup crack ; webs of fine lines grew like the shadows of a vine , and then a chip[0-i]

dropped from the edge of the cup , exposing the rough , unglazed interior . " What 's [he]216-roy baty doing ? "[215-irmgard] [Irmgard Baty]215-irmgard 's voice came to [him]1603-he distantly . " [He]216-roy baty 's breaking everything ! [Isidore]112-isidore , stop- "[215-irmgard] " [I]1603-he 'm not doing it , "[1603-he] [he]1603-he said . [He]1603-he walked unsteadily into [the living room]295-the living room , to be by [himself]1603-he ; [he]1603-he stood by the tattered couch and gazed at the yellow , stained wall with all the spots which dead bugs , that had once crawled , had left , and again [he]1603-he thought of the corpse of the spider with its four remaining legs . Everything in [here]1780-here is old , [he]1603-he realized . It long ago began to decay and it wo n't stop . The corpse of the spider has taken over . In the depression caused by the sagging of the floor , pieces of animals manifested themselves , the head of a crow , mummified hands which might have once been parts of monkeys . A donkey stood a little way off , not stirring and yet apparently alive ; at least it had not begun to deteriorate . [He]1603-he started toward [it]1606-it , feeling stick - like bones , dry as weeds , splinter under [his]1603-he shoes . But before [he]1603-he could reach the donkey - one of the creatures which [he]1603-he loved the most - a shiny blue crow fell from above to perch on the donkey 's unprotesting muzzle . Do n't , [he]1603-he said aloud , but the crow , rapidly , picked out the donkey 's eyes . Again , [he]1603-he thought . It 's happening to [me]0-i again . [I]0-i will be down [here]1780-here a long time , [he]1603-he realized . As before . It 's always long , because nothing here ever changes ; a point comes when it does not even decay . A dry wind rustled , and around [him]1603-he the heaps of bones broke . Even the wind destroys them , [he]1603-he perceived . At this stage . just before time ceases . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could remember how to climb up from here , [he]1603-he thought . Looking up [he]1603-he saw nothing to grasp . [Mercer]103-mercer , [he]1603-he said aloud . The heat . It had become hot , now ; evidently time had passed . And [he]1704-he felt hunger . [He]1704-he had not eaten for god knew how long . The hunger and heat combined , a poisonous taste resembling defeat ; yes , [he]1704-he thought , that 's what it is : [I]0-i 've been defeated in some obscure way . By having killed [the androids]638-the androids ? By [Rachael]137-rachael 's murder of [[my]0-i goat]1706-my goat ? [He]1704-he did not know , but as [he]1704-he plodded along a vague and almost hallucinatory pall hazed over [his]1704-he mind ; [he]1704-he found [himself]1704-he at one point , with no notion of how it could be , a step from an almost certainly fatal cliffside fall - falling humiliatingly and helplessly , [he]1704-he thought ; on and on , with [no one even to witness it]1707-no one even to witness it . Here there existed [no one]327-no one to record [his]1704-he or [anyone else]1709-anyone else 's degradation , and any courage or pride which might manifest itself here at the end would go unmarked - the dead stones , the dust - stricken weeds dry and dying , perceived nothing , recollected nothing , about [him]1704-he or [themselves]1710-themselves . At that moment the first rock - and it was not rubber or soft foam plastic - struck [him]1704-he in [the inguinal region]1711-the inguinal region . And the pain , the first knowledge of absolute isolation and suffering , touched [him]1704-he throughout in its undisguised actual form . [He]1704-he halted . And then , goaded on - the goad invisible but real , not to be challenged - [he]1704-he resumed [his]1704-he climb . 22

[He]95-rick set the receiver back down and did not take [his]95-rick eyes from the spot that had moved outside [the car]954-the car . The bulge in the ground , among the stones . An animal , [he]95-rick said to [himself]95-rick . And [his]95-rick heart lugged under the excessive load , the shock of recognition . [I]0-i know what it is , [he]95-rick realized ; [I]0-i 've never seen one before but [I]0-i know it from the old nature films [they]1738-they show on Government TV . [They]1738-they 're extinct ! [he]95-rick said to [himself]95-rick ; swiftly [he]95-rick dragged out [his]95-rick much - creased Sidney 's , turned the pages with twitching fingers . TOAD ( Bufonidae ) , all varieties ............ E. Extinct for years now . The critter most precious to [Wilbur Mercer]103-mercer , along with the donkey . But toads most of all . [I]0-i need a box . [He]95-rick squirmed around , saw nothing in the back seat of [the hovercar]1056-the hovercar ; [he]95-rick leaped out , hurried to the trunk compartment , unlocked and opened it . There rested a car board container , inside it a spare fuel pump for [[his]95-rick car]1812-his car . [He]95-rick dumped the fuel pump out , found some furry hempish twine , and walked slowly toward the toad . Not taking [his]95-rick

eyes from it . The toad , [he]95-rick saw , blended in totally with the texture and shade of the ever - present dust . It had , perhaps , evolved , meeting the new climate as it had met all climates before . Had it not moved [he]95-rick would never have spotted it ; yet [he]95-rick had been sitting no more than two yards from it . What happens when [you]1741-you find - if [you]1741-you find - an animal believed extinct ? [he]95-rick asked [himself]95-rick , trying to remember . It happened so seldom . Something about a star of honor from [the U.N.]48-the u.n. and a stipend . A reward running into millions of dollars . And of all possibilities - to find the critter most sacred to [Mercer]103-mercer . [Jesus]267-jesus , [he]95-rick thought ; it ca n't be . Maybe it 's due to brain damage on [my]0-i part : exposure to radioactivity . [I]0-i 'm [a special]2413-a special , [he]95-rick thought . Something has happened to [me]0-i . Like [the chickenhead Isidore]151-isidore and [his]151-isidore spider ; what happened to [him]151-isidore is happening to [me]0-i . Did [Mercer]103-mercer arrange it ? But [I]0-i 'm [Mercer]103-mercer . [I]0-i arranged it ; [I]0-i found the toad . Found it because [I]0-i see through [Mercer]103-mercer 's eyes . [He]95-rick squatted on [his]95-rick haunches , close beside the toad . [It]1743-it had shoved aside the grit to make a partial hole for itself , displaced the dust with its rump . So that only the top of its flat skull and its eyes projected above ground . Meanwhile , [its]1743-it metabolism slowed almost to a halt , it had drifted off into a trance . The eyes held no spark , no awareness of [him]95-rick , and in horror [he]95-rick thought , [It]1743-it 's dead , of thirst maybe . But it had moved . Setting the cardboard box down , [he]95-rick carefully began brushing the loose soil away from the toad . [It]1743-it did not seem to object , but of course it was not aware of [his]95-rick existence . When [he]95-rick lifted the toad out [he]95-rick felt [its]1743-it peculiar coolness ; in [his]95-rick hands its body seemed dry and wrinkled - almost flabby - and as cold as if it had taken up residence in [a grotto miles under the earth away from the sun]1744-a grotto miles under the earth away from the sun . Now the toad squirmed ; with its weak hind feet it tried to pry itself from [his]95-rick grip , wanting , instinctively , to go flopping off . [A big one]1745-a big one , [he]95-rick thought ; full - grown and wise . Capable , in its own fashion , of surviving even that which [we]1746-we 're not really managing to survive . [I]0-i wonder where it finds the water for its eggs .
